item.title: Maxwell Equations: An Overview
item.description: Maxwell’s equations are a set of four fundamental laws that describe how electric and magnetic fields interact. These laws, formulated by James Clerk Maxwell in the mid-19th century, are the foundation of classical electrodynamics. 1 Gauss’s Law for Electric Fields Gauss’s law for electric ﬁelds deals with electrostatic ﬁelds. It states that the electric flux out of a closed surface is proportional to the charge enclosed by that surface. To understand this law, we first have to introduce the divergence theorem.
